description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Global Product Partnerships (GPP) Strategy and Operations plays a critical role in helping drive strategy and execution for Global Product Partnerships. We focus on delivering thought leadership, operational rigor, and executive level narratives to help advance GPP and Google’s product mission. We work directly with GPP Leaders on priority topics across all product areas and help the global organization identify, plan for, and execute against their highest priorities.

This role reports into the Director of Business Strategy and Operations for Global Product Partnerships.

The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google’s own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google’s user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy, or equivalent experience in a technology/media company.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 10 years experience at a management consulting firm, corporate strategy team, investment bank, or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in technology and emerging/early stage products.
  • Experience in managing high performing/distributed teams.
  • Experience in a strategy/advisory role in a large/global organization.
  • Effective communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills. Developed analytical, problem solving and quantitative modeling skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage an existing team of Googlers to provide strategy and operations support to GPP leaders and their teams across multiple product area.
  • Deliver thought leadership and strategic guidance on product area specific topics and cross-product area efforts to help senior leaders in GPP make better decisions and work more efficiently.
  • Build consensus and alignment across GPP Global and Region team, as well as critical cross-functional stakeholders in Product, gTech, Marketing, Legal, Finance, and Global Partnerships frontline teams.
  • Drive prioritization of initiatives that enhance GPP’s ability to partner to build Google products.
  • Create clear, simple, and persuasive narratives to inform and consult senior-level-executives.
title: Head of Global Strategy, Global Product Partnerships
